definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Shorthand and typewriting have been described as the twin arts.
sentences.chinese: 速記和打字被說成是一對孿生技巧。
她於下午5時產下孿生兒。

sentences.english: She is often mistaken for her twin sister.
sentences.chinese: 她常被誤認爲她的孿生姐姐。

sentences.english: People are always confusing the twins.
sentences.chinese: 人們常誤認這兩位孿生子。

sentences.english: Then, mao Zhijian discovery is small beautiful still have Zu Xiaoai of elder sister of a twin.
sentences.chinese: 接着，毛志堅發現小麗還有一個孿生姐姐祖小艾。

sentences.english: Gross crystalline imperfections like twinning are apparent to the unaided eye .
sentences.chinese: 粗的晶體不完整性，如孿生體可用肉眼看出。

sentences.english: In the ideology of many ethnics, the twins have the same soul.
sentences.chinese: 在許多民族的觀念中，孿生子具有同一個靈魂。

sentences.english: The twenty-two twins twisted wrists twice on the Christmas Eve.
sentences.chinese: 二十二個孿生子在聖誕前夜擰了兩次手腕。

sentences.english: New style industrialization and urbanization are twins in the process of modernization.
sentences.chinese: 新型工業化與城鎮化是現代化進程中的一對孿生子。

sentences.english: It is hard to distinguish him from his twin brother.
sentences.chinese: 很難辨認出他和他的孿生兄弟。

sentences.english: I can't tell him from his twin brother.
sentences.chinese: 我分不出他和他的孿生兄弟。

sentences.english: Surgery has been cancelled to separate three-year-old twin girls joined at the head.
sentences.chinese: 分開兩名3歲大頭顱相連的孿生兒的手術被取消。

sentences.english: So that's why love and faith must be emotional, spiritual twins.
sentences.chinese: 因此，愛和信心是情感與屬靈的孿生兒。

sentences.english: Well, Corin and I were twins.
sentences.chinese: 哦，原來科林和我是孿生兄弟。

sentences.english: The twin sisters have a happy disposition.
sentences.chinese: 這一對孿生姐妹有一種樂天的性格。

definition: close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
(of siblings) having the same father but different mothers/half (brother or sister)
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to know each other/to recognize/to identify/to acknowledge (an old relationship)
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
